about.homeQuote: Bringing beautifully designed experiences to life through coding, testing, and just the right amount of technical magic. More about me »
about.aboutQuote: My name is Brandon Morse. I am a New Jersey-based, developer with a passion to innovate and to create a better web. I've worked with many great clients, such as: Walmart, Ikea, Lenovo, The Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, and more! Pushing the digital envelope, my analytical and creative thinking drives me to bridge the gap between client fantasies and digital realities to bring incredible interactive experiences to life.
about.caseStudiesQuote: Bridging the gap between client fantasies and digital realities.
about.trackRecordQuote: With over 15 years of experience, I have demonstrated success in communicating technical/complex information in understandable language to non-technical and technical personnel; plan and execute presentations, write proposals, system documentation and client reference materials.

services.title: Web Development
services.description: I approach every web design project with passion and determination, from initial research and data analysis to post-launch support. I deliver smooth, mobile-friendly customer experiences, and yield strong results in improved website performance, SEO, and conversions.

services.title: Voice Assistants
services.description: Want to know about local school closings, have Alexa control your smart home, or even tell you horrible Dad jokes? If you have an idea for a custom Alexa skill, I can help bring that idea to reality and get it published to the Amazon marketplace.

services.description: Email marketing is a cheap and effective way to reach your customers, build a community and increase sales. Engage subscribers, nurture leads and track results with beautiful, responsive emails.

services.title: Let's Work Together
services.description: Looking for a website? Need an engaging email to drive customers to your site? Just asking for advice? I can't wait to tackle whatever challenge you are having.

overview.description: Subscription box website for baby products for new and expecting mothers.

description.title: challenge
description.description: Walmart approached us about creating two subscription box model sites, one for new and expecting mothers, and the other for women's beauty products. While these are two completely separate sites, the core functionality was the same. We had to create an architecture that was sophisticated enough to know the user and where they were on their personal buyer's journey, but efficient enough to not duplicate efforts on shared functionality.

description.title: results
description.description: Combine with the Beauty Box Subscription Site, generated over 188k users and $2.1M in less than a year.

overview.description: Subscription box website for beauty products for women of all ages.

description.title: challenge
description.description: Walmart approached us about creating two subscription box model sites, one for new and expecting mothers, and the other for women's beauty products. While these are two completely separate sites, the core functionality was the same. We had to create an architecture that was sophisticated enough to know the user and where they were on their personal buyer's journey, but efficient enough to not duplicate efforts on shared functionality.

description.title: results
description.description: Combine with the Baby Box Subscription Site, generated over 188k users and $2.1M in less than a year.

overview.description: Pennsylvania Travel is a travel agency for unique global vacation deals.

description.title: challenge
description.description:
PATravel is a small boutique travel agency. Their original site was running on many legacy technologies and was not responsive. A large portion of the site's content was driven by a 3rd-part feed that would be scraped on page load. Unfortunately, the feel often results in broken images, and error pages, which would result in broken pages on PATravel's website.

They also had a CMS to allow custom additions of vacation packages, however it was constantly broken, and wasn't intuitive for the client to use. There wasn't an option to manage their blog via the CMS either, which resulted in the weekly blog posts to be manually added.

description.title: solution
description.description:
We rebuilt the site from the ground up, starting with a mobile-first design. Using analytics and an updated brand strategy, we enhanced the user experience across all browsers and devices, allowing users to get to the information they wanted with ease.

We replaced the custom CMS with ProcessWire, a PHP-based, secure content management system and framework. Management of the blog was built into the system along with the ability to manage call-tracking phone numbers for custom landing pages to align with the content marketing strategy we put together.

We updated the way the 3rd-party feed provided content for the website. The feed is now parsed as an automated system task, that loads the information into the CMS. This allows system admins to update or remove any information as needed, to keep a clean and consistent experience for PATravel's users.

description.title: results
description.description: Client is able to manage 100% of the content displayed on the site, regardless the original source of the data. With all data in the CMS, site is now able to have a more robust search integrated throughout the site. Regular blog articles are no longer a sore issue and are able to be added freely though the CMS. Landing pages with call tracking have the ability to display an unlimited set of numbers, allowing scalability in their content marketing strategy.

overview.description: The official website of the US Association of Rugby League.

description.title: Challenge
description.description:
The original website was built as a WordPress site. Unfortunately, the way in which it was built included altering the 'core system', leaving it unable to be updated. This meant security vulnerabilities were unable to be addressed causing the site to be hacked multiple times over the years. The fragile state of the site also meant that making minor content updates (ie, creating new pages) a more cumbersome task than it needed to be.

Another challenge with the website was the 'League Manager', was a partially built out plugin that required the deletion of the prior year's teams, conferences, standings, etc. to set up the upcoming season's game management.

The last challenge was that the site was not responsive.

description.title: Solution
description.description:
First and foremost, we addressed the security concerns, moving the site into ProcessWire. We created a new League Manager to be an integral part of the site's content and structure. It all starts with the teams. Each team has their own page, with history, plater roster, schedule and more. Due to the scalability of league, the number of teams and conferences varied from season to season. We took this into consideration, allowing admins to define the conferences and which teams were in each for each year. By using the teams' 'ids' as references, we were able to create a history of previous years, despite if a team didn't play certain years, or was zoned into a different conference.

The system also allowed for News and Video Library sections, complete with tag management. This tagging system allowed for relevant articles and videos to be dynamically pulled into the team pages as well.

Another new offering provided, was a portal for users to find out how to get involved with the league, as well as current members to be able to pay their membership dues.

description.title: Results
description.description: Since the launch of the site, it is no longer a victim of malicious attacks. Updates are able to be managed by content administrations, and no longer require a developer. Users have a more complete and engaging experience no matter which device or browser they are viewing the site.

overview.description: A global pharmaceutical and biotechnology consulting company.

description.title: challenge
description.description: Tunnell engaged us to update their website to a modernized and responsive design. Their updated web presence was to communicate Tunnell's story in a way that conveys the impact their services have on the life sciences industry at large. In addition, the website was meant to draw new organizational talent and communicate Tunnell's evolving services.

description.title: solution
description.description: Before approaching the website redesign, we developed buyer personas, a positioning statement, and a Brand Playbook that worked to inform the website architecture and user experience. The homepage story and internal pages were heavily based on feedback received in the client and customer interviews that made up the Brand Playbook.

description.title: results
description.description: We created a fresh, modern design that is simple to use and easy to navigate. With an emphasis placed on SEO and responsive design, the new website is set to perform and behave significantly better across all devices. It tells the Tunnell story effectively, positioning them as a professional and reputable consulting firm within the life sciences industry.

overview.description: iPipeline is a technology provider of SaaS solutions that drives straight-through processing for the insurance and financial services industry.

description.title: challenge
description.description: iPipeline, a B2B technology provider offering web-based software tools that streamline processing for the insurance industry, hired us to modernize their brand, create a responsive website or multiple platforms, and enhance their offline collateral.

description.title: solution
description.description: We conducted a series of interviews to create a brand playbook that established a positioning statement, brand identity and creative mood boards to communicate the brand's message. A website 'proof of concept' was delivered to present content drivers, user experience, responsive design and a grey box prototype. The website was developed using the ExpressionEngine CMS and launched with multiple languages.

description.title: results
description.description: The website hosts a blog, news, webinars, events and a careers portal, as well as a series of 'explanamation' videos to help guide users to their product offerings. The end result is a website that is modern and fresh, works seamlessly across multiple screen sizes or devices and that weill help iPipeline's new brand stand out within its industry with content marketing.

overview.description: A Blue Cross Blue Shield affiliated brand for travel health insurance.

description.title: challenge
description.description: GeoBlue (a Blue Cross Blue Shield affiliated brand) is a leader in the travel health insurance industry. We were hired by GeoBlue to develop an all-new website experience that seamlessly integrated with their complex back-end quoting tool; and upon launch, build out a digital strategy to support the site.

description.title: solution
description.description: We utilized a persona based methodology to identify content drivers that would inform the strategy for both web experience and online marketing plan. Additionally, the website launch was supported by an advertising campaign alerting their broker network of the new members tools and online resources.

description.title: results
description.description: A silver winner at the 2013 W3 Awards, the GeoBlue travel health insurance website has recorded increased conversion rates through the introduction of 'Find your Plan' and Dynamic Quoting results features. Content Marketing through organic traffic (SEO) and targeted PPC campaigns have generated over 20,000 visitors a month.

overview.description: A Blue Cross Blue Shield affiliated brand for travel health insurance.
Expanding lightweight material solutions, globally.

description.title: challenge
description.description: ARPRO® is JSP International's brand name for a premium Expanded Polypropylene (EPP) product. EPP is an impact energy management material with a unique combination of properties including energy absorption, structural strength, low weight, chemical resistance, and both thermal and acoustical insulation. While ARPRO® is the leading brand of EPP, there are many generic offerings, making it difficult for ARPRO® to rank organically for non-branded keywords and attributes of EPP.

description.title: solution
description.description: We collaborated with JSP to create personas around potential customers that would not be familiar with ARPRO®. Then crafted an interactive experience and content targeted towards those users, around EPP and other keywords identified in the persona exercise; allowing ARPRO® to compete with organic rankings against "generic" EPP products.

description.title: results
description.description: EPP has been well-received and achieved page one rankings for core keywords and increased website visit duration by 190%. Bounce rate was decreased by 19% and is now acting as an effective lead generation website.

overview.description: Interactive Touch Screen for XIAFLEX<sup>®</sup> for <nobr>Dupuytren's contracture.</nobr>

description.title: solution
description.description:
At the 2018 American Society for Surgery of the Hand (ASSH) conference, we created a convention booth experience unlike any other. We literally brought our latest campaign to life and invited hand surgeons to enter the interactive world of a patient with DC—the XIAFLEX® "garage." To help hand surgeons become more comfortable with using XIAFLEX® and gain a deeper understanding of their patients' challenges, this garage provided several dynamic, self-navigated opportunities for training and learning.

iPads with preloaded modules offered individual on-the-spot training on treating with XIAFLEX®, while touch panels peppered throughout the booth allowed hand surgeons to view clinical data and patient profiles. Hand surgeons could also step directly into their patients' shoes by wearing a special motorcycle glove we helped design that simulated what it feels like to have DC. They could even hop onto an actual motorcycle we parked in the booth.

description.title: results
description.description:
Our interactive, in-your-face efforts to reach HCPs in a meaningful way were a hands-down success. Not only did we engage about 2,145 HCPs attending ASSH—sourcing nearly 50 high-quality leads at the XIAFLEX® booth—but the ASSH board of directors deemed the experience we created "the new gold standard."

See the iPad presentations that were also installed in the booth.

overview.description: Joe Hand Promotions is the proud distributor of pay-per-view UFC, Showtime Boxing, and WWE Wrestling events for commercial locations.

description.title: challenge
description.description: Joe Hand Promotions is the official promoter of UFC fights to bars, restaurants, and other large commercial establishments. We were hired to refresh their brand, redesign their website, and increase their visibility online when they realized previous offline marketing efforts were no longer driving sales.

description.title: solution
description.description: We created a new brand identity and logo. In order to architect an intelligent user experience on the website, personas were created to map out the buying journey and trigger points for conversion. Content Marketing tactics including landing pages and blog articles are routinely created to increase the SEO rankings and overall marketshare.

description.title: results
description.description: Since launching the website in May 2013, their website traffic has doubled and organic visits have increasing by 72%. Overall, fight night sales goals have been exceeded consistently. Joe Hand Jr. has expressed that the brand evolution and digital presence have really changed and improved his business.
